translated: . The Chronicle of the Buddha Sikhī
“After Vipassī,🔽the best of men, the Supreme Buddha,
was without equal, without a peer.
Having crushed Māra’s army,🔽he attained the highest Awakening;
he set rolling the Wheel of the Dhamma,
out of compassion for living beings.
When the Wheel of the Dhamma was set rolling
by Sikhī, the Best of Victors,
attained the first stage of the path.

analyzed: aparam pi dhammam desente  gaṇaseṭṭhe naruttame
translated: When he taught the Dhamma again,🔽the Best of Hosts, the Best of Men,
attained the second stage of the path.
When he showed the Twin Miracle
to the world with its gods,
attained the third stage of the path.
of those whose corruptions were destroyed, who were spotless,
calm of heart, and perfected.🔽The first assembly of the disciples
of the one whose corruptions had gone,

analyzed: paṭhamaḥ āsi samāgamaḥ  asīti bhikkhu sahassāna
dutiyaḥ āsi samāgamaḥ  sattati bhikkhu sahassānaṃ

translated: Unstained like a lotus in the water,
I was brought up in the water.
I satisfied the Saṅgha headed by the Sambuddha

analyzed: niccam daḷham upaṭṭhita  saḥ upi mama buddhaḥ

translated: That Buddha, Sikhī, the Leader of the world,🔽Proclaimed to me:
There will be a delightful city called Kapila,
we will be face to face with him.’
the noble one was called Aruṇa;
these three were the chief palaces.
he went forth by elephant chariot;
For eight months the best of men,
Sikhī, the leader of the world,
The great hero set the wheel in motion,
the best of men in the Deer Park.
The enlightenment tree of that Blessed One,
is said to be the puṇḍarīka.

analyzed: cittā ca iva su guttā ca

translated: That Buddha was of great height,
the light extending three leagues.🔽The life of that Great Seer
Having rained down the cloud of the Dhamma,
having satisfied the world with its gods,
having led them to the other shore of Nibbāna,

analyzed: nibbutaḥ saḥ sa sāvakaḥ  anubyañjana sampanna  dvatti savara lakkhaṇa
translated: he was extinguished together with his disciples.🔽The one endowed with the minor characteristics,🔽the one with the thirty-two marks,
are not all conditioned things void?
The Buddha Sikhī, the excellent sage,
was extinguished in the Assaka Grove.
